content:
hi all!
I am a newbie in rust language and a on/off lurker of rust project in general. I would like to contribute on simple issues, documentation, code reviews and housekeeping tasks. I would really appreciate if someone could mentor me to get started, like choosing new tasks and some pointers to getting it done. Or if i could shadow someone either a begineer like me or experienced memeber doing begineer friendly work.

A great place to start would be contributing to the dev guide: https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues
That way you learn about the compiler and make it easier for others to learn as well :)

I haven't written it up into an issue, but I noticed last night that adding new unstable flags is undocumented, it would be nice to add those to the stability section. There's an example PR here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79525
and welcome to the project! It's always great to have new people :heart:
... I should probably get around to https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/issues/953
Cool I’ll check that out, thank you
